instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01958 No Power Stuck 5V 0.00A
threads.message:
So i've got an 820-01958 liquid damaged and it's stuck at 5V 0A - it's been ultrasonic cleaned and looks good now. Only real area of corrosion was around U6960 where we had R6960 loose and has been replaced. All other resistors are connected and measuring normally. 

PPBUS_G3H is 12.3V
Device is not detected in DFU mode when connected to another mac
PP3v3_G3H_RTC is missing and is not shorted to ground
CHGR_EN_MVR is also missing and is not shorted to ground
U6960 has been removed and resoldered - there was no corrosion underneath.

Unsure about this one as 12.3v PPBUS would indicate T2 communication issue but also got missing PP3V3_G3H_RTC and i'm not sure if that should only come up after PPBUS voltage goes up.

threads.title: 820-01958 No Power Stuck 5V 0.00A
threads.message:
T2 can't work without 3V3_G3H_RTC.
Change U7000; or remove and resolder it first.
May have accumulated crap underneath.

threads.title: 820-01958 No Power Stuck 5V 0.00A
threads.message: I'll order a new U7000 and try that first

threads.title: 820-01958 No Power Stuck 5V 0.00A
threads.message: U7000 replaced and same behaviour - it has made no difference.

threads.title: 820-01958 No Power Stuck 5V 0.00A
threads.message:
Post U7000 basic voltages; P_IN, AUX_DET, SMC_RST_IN, VDDA/P, CBC_ON, EN_MVR, A/BMON.
Be sure to have correct resistance over C7020/23.
